title: Sean Minor 2015 Nicole Marie Red (North Coast)
description: Deliciously dry and mouthfilling, this full-bodied red packs in black cherry, boysenberry and mint flavors and wraps them in a velvety, softly tannic texture. Made from Merlot, Petite Sirah, Zinfandel and Petit Verdot, it has wonderful ripeness and richness.

title: Carpineto 2010 Vigneto Poggio Sant'Enrico  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aromas of underbrush, pipe tobacco, toasted oak and a whiff of baked plum appear in the forefront. The tightly wound palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and grilled herb framed in austere close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to relax then drink to catch the fruit richness.

title: Château Duhart-Milon 2015 Moulin de Duhart  (Pauillac)
description: A smooth, ripe wine, this is full of juicy Merlot, with good spice and acidity. It has tannins to be sure although these are almost lost in the explosive rich red fruits. A well-structured, fruity wine, it will be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2008 Gran Reserva Excelso  (Rioja)
description: A reserved earthy nose smells a bit leafy and stalky. A wide palate with hard tannins delivers textbook Rioja flavors of dried cherry and spiced berry fruits. An earthy note alongside chocolate on the finish ensures that is very much in the vein of Rioja gran reserva. Drink through 2027.

title: Château Laride 2014 L'Iris de Laride  (Haut-Médoc)
description: The old vines of the Laride estate go into this wine. Serious wood aging has given a dark-toast and bitter-chocolate character that currently masks the rich blackberry and black-plum fruits. The wine needs time. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Leboscq 2015  Médoc
description: From a blend dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine. Its tannins and black-currant fruit are balancing well, giving both a dry side and a rich, juicy aftertaste. This wine has good potential, so drink from 2022.

title: Château Maucaillou 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: The richness and the potential of the ripe fruits promise well for this wine. Considerable barrel aging has marked it at this stage, giving it a spicy character. It suggests this is a wine for aging because the black-plum and berry fruits are nowhere near ready. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Moulin de l'Abbaye 2015  Médoc
description: This wine is structured and ripe, with firm tannins and black-currant flavors. It offers nice balance and finesse. Drink from 2023.

title: Contadi Castaldi 2013 Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: Pear, citrus zest, brioche and toast aromas flow over to the vibrant palate along with tangerine and yellow apple skin. Bright acidity and small continuous bubbles lend freshness and finesse. A bitter-almond note closes the finish.

title: Dablon 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Delightful aromas of red plum and cherry tomato float above bread dough and basil on the nose. The juicy palate brings tart cherry and more plum into the mix, with white pepper and green herb accents. This offers a light and easy mouthfeel full of vibrant acidity and structured by velvety tannins. The juicy cherry finish is utterly charming.

title: David & Nadia 2015 David Aristargos White (Swartland)
description: A blend of 35% Chenin Blanc, 23% Roussanne, 15% Clairette, 19% Viognier and 8% Sémillon, this is dense and softly toasty upfront, with seductive notes of baked apple, pressed yellow flowers, dried orange peel, straw and lanolin. The palate is similarly lush and decadent, though with an ample seam of acidity to keep it all in check. Drink now–2022.

title: Château Cantelys 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 88–91. Barrel Sample. Bright red fruits and gentle tannins carry this wine. It has a juicy feel, with a fruity backdrop and a light structure on the finish. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Haut Breton Larigaudière 2015  Margaux
description: With vines in Soussans, in the northern part of the Margaux appellation, this family estate has produced a ripe, fruity wine. Its structure is still firmly in place, giving a dense wine that will need to age and broaden out. Drink from 2022.

title: Château La Lauzette 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: A ripe, balanced wine, this is full of generous fruit, rich tannins and blackberry flavors. Acidity comes through this concentrated wine to give a crisp edge. This wine, with a blend dominated by 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, will age well. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Bellefont-Belcier 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Ripe red fruits give this wine a luscious character balanced by firm tannins. The dry core is firmly dominant at this stage although there is plenty of fruit for the future. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Cadet-Bon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–90. Barrel Sample. Ripe and smoky, this rich wine is solidly structured. Firm tannins promise that this wine will age well, while the freshness of the vintage is expressed through vibrant fruit flavors and acidity. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Franc Mayne 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This perfumed wine is tight, yet crisp and juicy. Bright black currant flavors with considerable acidity indicate this wine is likely to age well. Drink after 2024.

title: Chãteau Jacques Blanc 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This smoky wine has ripe, juicy fruit backed by spicy, dense tannins to give weight. It is rich with bold Merlot flavors, likely to be ready from 2022.

title: Château la Vieille Cure 2017 Barrel Sample  (Fronsac)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine's generous black fruit flavors are rich and smoothly textured. It is firmly structured, with a solid backdrop of tannins, but there is an opulent richness that comes from the Merlot in the blend. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Lusseau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Attractive fruit flavors and fine acidity are balanced by ripe tannins from this small property. It has a smoky backdrop of fine tannins which sit easily with the ripe fruit. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Château Haura 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Spicy new wood and generous tannins give this wine a rich roundness. It has a full mouthfeel, packed with blackberry and plum flavors giving layers of spice and fine concentration. It should age well, drink from 2022.

title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. A warm, ripe and fruity wine, this is rich in white stone-fruit flavors but also cut by minerality and taut acidity. It is likely to take some time to mature, so try after 2020.

title: Château Coufran 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This classic estate has produced an excellent wine. Its tannins are firm while the black plum and berry fruits are ripe and concentrated. It will age slower than many wines from this appellation, and will not be ready to drink before 2024.

title: Château du Cartillon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. While this wine has plenty of tannins, it is the fruit that is so good here. The black currant flavors of Cabernet Sauvignon dominate and give the wine an open fruitiness. Drink from 2023.

title: Clos du Marquis 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. From young vines, this is a fine wine, lightly structured and with swathes of delicious, juicy fruit. The gentle tannins give the wine shape to balance the luscious fruit notes of the wine.

title: Dr. Fischer 2016 Bockstein Ockfen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Plumes of saffron, spice and crushed earth accent ripe yellow-cherry and honeysuckle notes in this deeply honeyed spätlese. Equal parts sun-kissed fruit and earth offset by dazzling lemon-lime acidity, it's a deftly balanced wine that offers a pleasantly astringent finish.

title: Ferghettina 2013 Milledi Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Delicate alluring scents of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and bread dough float out of the glass along with a whiff of dried herb. On the palate, a refined mousse backs up white peach, yellow apple and toasted hazelnut.

title: Fitz-Ritter 2016 Dürkheimer Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Forward, fruity tones of peach candy and tangerine stand in contrast to this producer's leaner, earthier Abtsfronhof bottling. They share the same deeply embedded minerality that lends elegance and structure to this dry but approachable wine. While frisky and spry on the midpalate, the finish is long and lean.

title: Francis Coppola 2014 Bevil-Wolcott Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a well-made vineyard-designate, showing a full embrace of integrated oak and full-bodied richness. Red fruit, leather, meat and black licorice all figure into the mix, as the thickness in the glass suggests decanting or time to air.

title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2013 Fraccianera Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: This crisp lively sparkler delivers aromas and flavors of yellow apple, juicy citrus zest, bread crust and savory mineral. It's balanced, with bright acidity while a refined continuous perlage lends finesse.
